citation.article-title: Transfer of Pantoea citrea, Pantoea punctata and Pantoea terrea to the genus Tatumella emend. as Tatumella citrea comb. nov., Tatumella punctata comb. nov. and Tatumella terrea comb. nov. and description of Tatumella morbirosei sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Tatumella citrea (Kageyama et al. 1992) comb. nov.
Tatumella citrea (ci′tre.a. L. fem. adj. citrea belonging to the citrus tree).
Basonym: Pantoea citrea Kageyama et al. 1992.
Cells are Gram-negative, short rods (0.8–1.2×1.0–3.0 μm) occurring singly or in pairs, non-motile and non-spore-forming.
Colonies are pale beige to pale orange, round, convex and smooth with entire margins.
Nicotinic acid or nicotinamide are required for growth.
Facultatively anaerobic, oxidase-negative, catalase-positive and glucose dehydrogenase, gluconate dehydrogenase and 2-ketogluconate dehydrogenase are produced.
Indole, urease and phenylalanine deaminase are negative, whereas arginine dihydrolase is positive.
Acid is produced from l-arabinose, d-fucose, d-galactose, d-glucose, glycerol, maltose, d-mannose, d-mannitol, d-tagatose and trehalose, but not from starch, raffinose or sucrose.

The following carbon sources are utilized at 28 °C: N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, cis-aconitic acid, l-arabinose, l-asparagine, l-aspartic acid, citrate, dextrin, erythritol, formic acid, d-fructose, d-galactose, gentiobiose (weak), d-gluconic acid, d-glucose, 5-ketogluconate, lactose, lactulose, d-malate, maltose, maltotriose, d-mannitol, pyruvic acid methyl ester, succinic acid and d-tagatose.

The following carbon sources are not utilized at 28 °C: d-adonitol, l-alanine, d-arabinose, betaine, dulcitol, l-fucose, methyl α-d-glucoside, methyl β-d-glucoside, d-galacturonic acid, d-glucuronic acid, glutarate, histidine, myo-inositol, melibiose, l-proline, propionate, quinic acid, raffinose, l-rhamnose, d-sorbitol, l-serine, sucrose, l-tartrate, meso-tartrate and trigonelline.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 49.8 mol%.
The type strain, SHS 2003T (=ATCC 31623T=BD 875T=CCUG 30156T=CIP 105599T=DSM 13699T=JCM 8882T=LMG 22049T), was isolated from mandarin orange in Japan.
